output: Yes, performance packages are available for an additional $15/day and feature high-end skis/boards, advanced boot technology, and premium bindings. Performance equipment includes the latest models from top manufacturers with enhanced edge hold, responsiveness, and comfort features. These upgrades are recommended for advanced skiers and snowboarders seeking superior on-snow performance.

instruction: How does your boot fitting process work?
output: Our certified boot fitters measure your feet, assess your skiing ability, and recommend appropriate boot models for optimal fit and performance. The fitting process includes trying multiple sizes and brands, custom footbed installation if needed, and adjustment of boot features. Proper boot fitting typically takes 15-20 minutes and is included free with all rental packages.

instruction: What are your kids' equipment rental options?
output: Kids' rental packages (ages 3-12) start at $35/day and include appropriately sized skis/boards, boots, bindings, poles, and safety straps. We stock equipment specifically designed for young skiers with softer flex patterns and beginner-friendly features. Helmets for kids are strongly recommended and rent for $10/day with special cartoon designs available.

instruction: Can I make rental reservations in advance?
output: Yes, equipment reservations can be made online at www.mightymountain.com or by calling (970) 555-SNOW up to 30 days in advance. Reservations guarantee equipment availability and allow for faster pickup with pre-filled paperwork. Walk-in rentals are also welcome, but availability may be limited during peak periods like holidays and powder days.

instruction: What happens if my rental equipment gets damaged?
output: Customers without damage insurance are responsible for a $50 deductible for minor damage like scratched bases or small dings. Severe damage, loss, or theft results in full replacement charges ranging from $300-800 depending on equipment type. Normal wear and tear from skiing is expected and not charged, but negligent damage or misuse may result in additional fees.

instruction: Do you offer multi-day rental discounts?
output: Yes, we offer 15% discounts on rentals of 3 or more consecutive days, and 20% discounts on 7+ day rentals. Multi-day packages must be paid in full at pickup and equipment must be returned on the final day. These discounts apply to both standard and performance packages but cannot be combined with other promotional offers.

instruction: What tuning services do you provide?
output: We offer professional ski and snowboard tuning services including basic tunes ($25), performance tunes ($35), and race tunes ($45). Services include base repair, edge sharpening, waxing, and binding adjustments. Tuning typically takes 2-4 hours during regular season, but same-day service is available for an additional $10 rush charge.

instruction: Can I exchange my rental equipment if it doesn't fit properly?
output: Yes, equipment exchanges for fit or performance issues are complimentary within the first 2 hours of pickup at any of our three rental locations. After 2 hours, exchanges are subject to a $10 service fee unless there's a documented equipment defect. We want to ensure you have properly fitting equipment for the best skiing experience possible.

instruction: Do you rent helmets and what styles are available?
output: We rent ski and snowboard helmets for $12/day in a variety of sizes and styles including traditional, lightweight, and kids' designs. All helmets meet current safety standards and are sanitized between uses. We strongly recommend helmets for all skiers and offer special pricing of $10/day when rented with equipment packages.

instruction: What are your rental hours at each location?
output: Base Lodge rental shop is open 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM daily with extended hours during peak season. Mid-Mountain Lodge rentals operate 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM for exchanges and adjustments. Summit House provides emergency equipment services 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM weather permitting. Hours may vary based on mountain operations and weather conditions.

instruction: Can I rent equipment for multiple people at once?
output: Yes, group rentals for families and parties are welcome and can be processed together for convenience. We recommend making advance reservations for groups of 6 or more to ensure equipment availability and faster service. Group discounts may apply for rentals of 10+ packages - call (970) 555-SNOW for group pricing information.

instruction: What brands of equipment do you carry?
output: We carry premium rental inventory from leading brands including Rossignol, Salomon, K2, Burton, and Atomic for skis and snowboards. Boot inventory includes Lange, Salomon, Rossignol, and Burton models in all sizes and ability levels. Our performance packages feature the latest models from these top manufacturers with current season technology.

instruction: How do I return my rental equipment?
output: Equipment returns are accepted at any of our three rental locations during operating hours, with no requirement to return to the original pickup location. Simply bring all equipment to the rental desk along with your rental agreement. Late returns after 5:00 PM at Base Lodge incur a $25 late fee unless arrangements are made in advance.

instruction: Do you offer snowshoe rentals?
output: Yes, we rent snowshoes and poles for $25/day with special winter hiking packages available. Snowshoe rentals include brief instruction on proper use and suggested trail maps for snowshoeing around the resort. Advanced reservations are recommended as snowshoe inventory is limited, especially during peak winter hiking season.

instruction: What is your policy on wet or dirty equipment returns?
output: Equipment should be returned reasonably clean and dry when possible, but we understand mountain conditions can be challenging. Excessively dirty equipment may incur a $15 cleaning fee, while equipment returned soaking wet from hot tubs or pools may result in damage charges. Normal snow and moisture from skiing is expected and not charged.

instruction: Can I rent equipment overnight or for multiple days?
output: Yes, multi-day rentals are encouraged and come with significant discounts. Equipment can be kept overnight between ski days for $10/night storage fee, or you can take it to your accommodation at no charge. Multi-day packages automatically include overnight privileges and eliminate the need for daily returns and pickups.

instruction: Do you provide equipment for adaptive skiing needs?
output: Yes, we work with adaptive ski programs to provide specialized equipment including sit-skis, outriggers, and modified equipment for skiers with disabilities. Advanced reservations are required for adaptive equipment, and we coordinate with instructors familiar with adaptive techniques. Contact our rental shop at (970) 555-SNOW to discuss specific needs and availability.

instruction: What sizes of equipment do you stock?
output: We stock ski equipment from kids' size 80cm to adult 185cm, boots from toddler size 8 to adult size 15, and snowboards from 100cm to 170cm lengths. Wide width boots and oversized equipment are available in limited quantities with advance notice. Our extensive inventory ensures proper sizing for guests of all ages and abilities.

instruction: How often is rental equipment serviced and updated?
output: All rental equipment receives daily safety inspections and professional tuning every 3-5 rental days to maintain optimal performance. Our fleet is updated annually with 30% new equipment each season, ensuring guests have access to current technology and well-maintained gear. Any equipment showing excessive wear is immediately removed from rental inventory.

instruction: Can I purchase my rental equipment?
output: Yes, rental equipment is available for purchase at discounted prices at the end of each season, typically March and April. Previous season rental equipment ranges from 40-70% off retail prices depending on condition and usage. Current availability and pricing for rental fleet sales can be found at www.mightymountain.com or by calling (970) 555-SNOW.

instruction: What happens if rental equipment breaks during use?
output: If equipment fails due to normal use or manufacturing defect, we provide free replacement equipment immediately at any rental location. Equipment failure due to misuse, jumping, or negligent handling may result in repair charges. Our staff is trained to assess failure causes and will work with customers to resolve issues fairly and quickly.

instruction: Do you offer storage for personal equipment?
output: Day storage for personal equipment is available at the Base Lodge for $5/day, while overnight storage is $10/night in our secure, heated facilities. Seasonal storage from November through April is available for $150 with advance reservation. All storage areas are monitored and climate-controlled to protect equipment from theft and weather damage.

instruction: Are there any restrictions on where I can take rental equipment?
output: Rental equipment must remain on Mighty Mountain property and cannot be taken to other ski areas or for backcountry skiing. Equipment is intended for resort skiing only on designated trails and terrain parks. Violation of this policy results in immediate termination of rental agreement and full replacement charges regardless of insurance coverage.

instruction: What is your boot sizing and fitting guarantee?
output: We guarantee proper boot fit and comfort for all rental customers with free exchanges within the first 2 hours if boots are uncomfortable or improperly fitted. Our certified boot fitters will remeasure, try different brands, or provide footbeds as needed. Properly fitted boots are essential for skiing enjoyment and safety, and we stand behind our fitting expertise.

instruction: Can I rent equipment for terrain park use?
output: Yes, our performance rental packages include equipment suitable for terrain park use with appropriate flex patterns and durability. Park-specific equipment is available upon request with bindings set for freestyle skiing or riding. We recommend damage insurance for terrain park use due to increased risk of equipment damage from jumps and rails.

instruction: Do you offer ski waxing services for rental equipment?
output: All rental equipment includes basic wax service and is maintained in optimal condition throughout the rental period. Additional hot wax services are available for $15 if you prefer premium wax or have specific snow condition requirements. Racing wax and temperature-specific wax services are available for performance packages at additional cost.

instruction: What payment methods do you accept for rentals?
output: We accept all major credit cards, cash, and resort gift certificates for equipment rentals and services. Credit card authorization is required for all rentals as security against damage or loss, even when paying with cash. Valid photo ID matching the credit card name is required for all rental transactions.

instruction: How early should I arrive to rent equipment?
output: We recommend arriving 30-45 minutes before lift opening to allow time for equipment fitting, paperwork, and brief orientation, especially during busy periods. First-time renters should allow additional time for boot fitting and equipment familiarization. Advance reservations significantly reduce wait times and ensure equipment availability during peak periods.

instruction: Do you rent equipment for night skiing or special events?
output: While Mighty Mountain doesn't offer night skiing, equipment rentals are available for special events, private parties, and off-mountain activities when approved in advance. Special event rentals require separate agreements and may have different pricing structures. Contact our rental department at (970) 555-SNOW to discuss specific event needs and availability.

instruction: What demo equipment options do you have?
output: Demo equipment featuring the latest models from premium manufacturers is available for $65/day and allows customers to test high-end gear before purchasing. Demo programs include detailed consultation with our equipment experts and credit toward purchase if you decide to buy. Demo availability is limited and advance reservations are highly recommended.

instruction: Can I get rental equipment adjusted during the day?
output: Yes, equipment adjustments are available at all three rental locations throughout the day including binding adjustments, boot modifications, and equipment exchanges. Minor adjustments are complimentary while significant changes may incur service fees. Mid-Mountain Lodge is particularly convenient for on-mountain adjustments and equipment issues.

instruction: What is included in your performance rental packages?
output: Performance packages ($60/day) include premium skis or snowboards, high-end boots with advanced features, performance bindings, and priority tuning services. These packages feature the latest technology including carbon fiber construction, advanced dampening systems, and professional-grade equipment. Performance packages are recommended for advanced intermediate to expert skiers seeking maximum on-snow performance.

instruction: Do you offer rental packages for beginners?
output: Yes, beginner packages start at $40/day and include forgiving skis or boards with beginner-friendly characteristics, comfortable boots with easy entry systems, and basic safety orientation. Beginner equipment features softer flex patterns and stable platforms to build confidence while learning. These packages are often paired with lesson programs for comprehensive learning experiences.

instruction: How do you handle equipment sizing for growing children?
output: Kids' equipment is sized conservatively for safety and learning, and we offer free size adjustments during the rental period as children's skills develop. Growth spurts during the season can be accommodated with equipment exchanges at no additional charge. Parents should inform our staff of children's rapid growth for appropriate equipment selection.

instruction: What safety features are included with rental equipment?
output: All rental equipment includes properly calibrated safety bindings that release during falls, sharp edges for control, and current safety technology. Ski bindings are set according to industry standards based on skier weight, height, ability, and age. Safety inspections occur daily, and any equipment not meeting safety standards is immediately removed from service.

instruction: Can I rent equipment for spring skiing conditions?
output: Yes, spring skiing equipment is available with appropriate wax and tuning for warmer, variable snow conditions typically found from March through April. Spring equipment setup includes softer wax for wet snow conditions and binding adjustments for changing temperatures. Our staff can recommend equipment modifications for optimal spring skiing performance.

instruction: Do you provide rental equipment for racing or competitions?
output: Racing equipment is available through our performance rental program with advance notice and includes race-tuned skis, racing boots, and competition-appropriate bindings. Race tuning services ($45) provide the precision edge work and wax needed for competitive skiing. Racers should reserve equipment well in advance as racing inventory is limited.

instruction: What happens if I lose my rental equipment?
output: Lost equipment must be reported immediately to rental staff and results in full replacement charges ranging from $300-800 depending on equipment type and age. Damage insurance does not cover lost equipment unless a police report is filed for theft. We provide equipment identification tags and recommend securing equipment when not in use.

instruction: Can I switch between skis and snowboard during my rental?
output: Equipment type changes from skis to snowboard or vice versa are allowed for a $15 exchange fee, subject to availability and boot compatibility. Complete equipment refitting is required for sport changes including new boots, bindings, and safety orientation. Same-day exchanges are available at any rental location during operating hours.

instruction: Do you offer rental discounts for resort guests?
output: Resort lodging guests receive 10% discounts on rental equipment when staying at partnered accommodations in Summit Valley. Additional discounts may be available through vacation packages or group bookings. Proof of accommodation is required, and discounts cannot be combined with other promotional offers. Check with our rental staff about current lodging partnerships and available discounts.

instruction: What is your policy on rental equipment modifications?
output: Minor equipment modifications such as binding adjustments, boot modifications, and stance changes are included with rental packages. Major modifications requiring permanent changes to equipment are not permitted on rental gear. Customers requiring significant equipment modifications should consider purchasing or bringing personal equipment to the resort.

instruction: How do you ensure rental equipment hygiene?
output: All rental equipment, especially boots and helmets, undergoes thorough sanitization between uses using EPA-approved disinfectants. Boot dryers and UV sanitization systems ensure equipment is clean, dry, and odor-free for each rental. Customers with specific hygiene concerns can request additional sanitization or consider bringing personal equipment.

instruction: Can I rent ski boots separately from other equipment?
output: Yes, ski boots can be rented separately for $20/day for customers who own skis but need boots while traveling. Boot-only rentals include professional fitting, basic footbeds if needed, and exchange privileges. Customers renting boots separately must ensure their personal skis are properly tuned and bindings are compatible and safely adjusted.

instruction: What backup options exist if equipment isn't available?
output: Equipment waitlists are maintained during peak periods, and we contact customers immediately when preferred equipment becomes available. Alternative equipment suggestions are always provided, and upgrade options may be offered at standard pricing when premium equipment is the only availability. Advance reservations are the best way to guarantee specific equipment types.

instruction: Do you rent equipment for summer activities?
output: During summer months (June-September), we rent mountain bikes, helmets, and protective gear for resort trail access via our gondola systems. Summer rental rates start at $35/day for bikes and $10/day for helmets. Summer operations are separate from winter programs with different inventory, pricing, and policies - check www.mightymountain.com for current summer rental information.

instruction: How do you handle equipment disputes or complaints?
output: Equipment concerns are addressed immediately by our rental supervisors with solutions including equipment replacement, service adjustments, or partial refunds when appropriate. Customer satisfaction is our priority, and we work diligently to resolve any equipment issues quickly. Unresolved disputes can be escalated to resort management through our guest services department.

instruction: What training do your rental staff receive?
output: All rental staff are certified in boot fitting, equipment selection, binding adjustment, and safety procedures through industry programs and ongoing training. Staff receive annual certification updates and are trained to assess customer needs, skiing ability, and appropriate equipment selection. Our experienced team averages 5+ years in the ski equipment industry.

instruction: Can I rent equipment for off-resort use like backcountry skiing?
output: Rental equipment is strictly prohibited for backcountry or off-resort use and violations result in immediate rental agreement termination and full replacement charges. Resort equipment is designed and maintained for groomed terrain use only and lacks the specialized features required for backcountry skiing safety. Customers interested in backcountry skiing should purchase or rent from specialized backcountry equipment providers.

instruction: What quality control measures ensure rental equipment safety?
output: Daily safety inspections include binding function testing, boot sole wear assessment, ski edge and base condition checks, and overall equipment integrity evaluation. Any equipment failing safety standards is immediately removed from rental inventory for repair or replacement. Quality control logs track equipment condition and service history to maintain our high safety standards.

instruction: How do weather conditions affect rental equipment selection?
output: Equipment selection varies based on daily weather conditions with harder wax for cold powder days and softer wax for warm spring conditions. Staff monitor daily weather reports and adjust equipment preparation accordingly including specialized tuning for ice, powder, or variable conditions. Customers can request specific equipment preparation based on anticipated weather and snow conditions.

instruction: What are your peak season rental policies?
output: During peak periods (holidays, powder days), advance reservations are strongly recommended and equipment availability is limited for walk-in customers. Peak season pricing may apply, and rental return times are strictly enforced to ensure equipment availability for all guests. Extended rental periods help guarantee equipment availability and reduce daily demand during busy times.

instruction: Can rental equipment be delivered to my accommodation?
output: Equipment delivery services are available to select accommodations in Summit Valley for $25/delivery with advance arrangements. Delivery includes complete equipment fitting at your location and pickup service at the end of your rental period. Delivery scheduling depends on location, weather conditions, and staff availability - call (970) 555-SNOW to arrange delivery services.

instruction: What happens if my rental boots cause discomfort or injury?
output: Boot-related discomfort should be reported immediately for equipment exchange, boot modification, or footbed installation at no charge. Our certified boot fitters will work to resolve fit issues and prevent injury from improperly fitting equipment. While we cannot guarantee elimination of all discomfort, proper boot fitting significantly reduces the risk of foot problems and enhances skiing enjoyment.

instruction: How do you track rental equipment throughout the day?
output: Rental equipment is tracked through digital systems recording customer information, equipment serial numbers, and return dates. RFID systems and regular equipment audits help locate missing equipment and ensure inventory accuracy. Lost or misplaced equipment can often be located through our tracking systems, though customers remain responsible for equipment until properly returned.

instruction: What specialized equipment do you offer for different skiing styles?
output: We stock equipment for all skiing styles including all-mountain skis, carving skis, powder skis, freestyle equipment, and touring setups. Equipment selection is based on customer ability level, preferred terrain, and skiing style preferences. Our knowledgeable staff can recommend appropriate equipment based on your skiing goals and mountain conditions.

instruction: How do you handle rental equipment during mountain closures?
output: During weather-related mountain closures, rental equipment can be returned without penalty or held for the following day at no additional charge. Equipment exchanges are available when conditions improve, and partial refunds may be issued for significant closures. Customers are notified of closure-related rental policies through resort communication channels and rental location postings.

instruction: What maintenance records do you keep for rental equipment?
output: Comprehensive maintenance logs track each piece of equipment including service dates, repairs performed, safety inspections, and usage history. Records help determine equipment replacement schedules and ensure safety standards are maintained throughout the equipment lifecycle. Maintenance documentation is available for inspection and helps resolve any equipment-related disputes or warranty issues.

instruction: Can I extend my rental period during my visit?
output: Rental extensions are available subject to equipment availability and can be processed at any rental location during operating hours. Extension rates follow standard daily pricing with applicable multi-day discounts when extensions qualify for longer-term rates. Extensions must be paid in full at the time of arrangement, and equipment returns must be scheduled accordingly.

instruction: What are your ski lesson prices and options?
output: We offer group lessons starting at $89 for 2 hours or $149 for all-day instruction. Private lessons are $199 for 2 hours or $349 all-day. Our beginner package includes lesson, equipment rental, and lift ticket for $199. All instructors are PSIA/AASI certified and group lessons are limited to 6 students maximum.

instruction: Do you have kids' ski programs?
output: Yes, our Kids' Ski School serves ages 4-12 with all-day programs for $179 including lesson, supervision, lunch, and snacks. Kids are grouped by age and ability level with maximum 8 children per instructor. Programs run 9 AM-3:30 PM at the Base Lodge Learning Center. Equipment rentals available for additional $25/day.

instruction: Where do ski lessons meet and what time?
output: All ski lessons meet at the Base Lodge Learning Center near the magic carpet lifts. Group lessons start at 9:00 AM and 1:00 PM daily, while private lessons can be scheduled at any time based on instructor availability. Check in begins 15 minutes before lesson start time for equipment fitting and paperwork.

instruction: What's included in your beginner ski package?
output: Our adult beginner package for $199 includes a 2-hour group lesson with PSIA certified instructor, full equipment rental (skis, boots, poles, helmet), and a restricted lift ticket for beginner terrain. The package provides everything needed for first-time skiers and represents significant savings compared to purchasing items separately. Package participants receive priority booking for follow-up lessons.

instruction: Do you offer advanced ski clinics?
output: Yes, we offer advanced clinics for $129 per half-day focusing on specific skills like carving, moguls, powder skiing, or terrain parks. These clinics are designed for intermediate to expert skiers looking to improve particular techniques. Maximum class size is 4 students, and clinics meet at 9:00 AM or 1:00 PM at the Base Lodge Learning Center.

instruction: How far in advance do I need to book lessons?
output: We require 24-hour advance booking for all lessons to guarantee instructor availability and appropriate class placement. Peak period lessons (holidays, weekends) should be booked 3-5 days in advance due to high demand. Bookings can be made online at www.mightymountain.com or by calling (970) 555-SNOW. Same-day lessons are available on a walk-in basis but not guaranteed.

instruction: What's the difference between ski and snowboard instruction?
output: Both ski and snowboard lessons follow similar pricing and scheduling but use specialized PSIA/AASI certified instructors for each sport. Snowboard lessons focus on balance, edge control, and linking turns, while ski lessons emphasize parallel turns and pole technique. Equipment and terrain requirements differ slightly, with snowboard beginners typically progressing faster initially but facing a steeper learning curve for advanced techniques.

instruction: What are your group lesson class sizes?
output: Adult group lessons are limited to maximum 6 students per instructor to ensure personalized attention and safety. Kids' group lessons accommodate up to 8 children per instructor with additional safety supervisors for younger groups. Small class sizes allow instructors to provide individual feedback while maintaining group dynamics for learning and fun.

instruction: Can I rent equipment through the ski school?
output: Yes, equipment rental packages are available through our ski school at the Base Lodge Learning Center for $35/day including skis/snowboard, boots, poles, and helmet. Lesson participants receive priority equipment fitting and can exchange equipment during the day if needed. Equipment is included in our beginner packages but available separately for all other lesson types.

instruction: Do you offer private snowboard lessons?
output: Yes, private snowboard lessons are available for $199 (2-hour) or $349 (all-day) with AASI certified instructors. Private lessons can accommodate 1-4 people at the same rate and allow customized instruction based on individual goals and learning styles. Advanced booking is required, and lessons can focus on beginner basics through advanced freestyle and freeride techniques.

instruction: What qualifications do your ski instructors have?
output: All Mighty Mountain instructors are certified through PSIA (Professional Ski Instructors of America) or AASI (American Association of Snowboard Instructors) with ongoing education requirements. Many instructors hold Level II or Level III certifications and specialize in specific areas like children's instruction, racing, or adaptive skiing. Our experienced instructor team averages 8+ years of teaching experience.

instruction: Are there lesson packages for multiple days?
output: Yes, we offer 3-day lesson packages at 15% discount and 5-day packages at 20% discount for both group and private lessons. Multi-day packages allow skill progression with the same instructor when possible and include lesson notes tracking your development. These packages must be used on consecutive days and are popular with vacation visitors seeking comprehensive instruction.

instruction: What's included in kids' all-day programs?
output: Kids' all-day programs ($179) include professional instruction, indoor lunch, healthy snacks, games, and structured activities from 9 AM-3:30 PM. Children are grouped by age (4-6, 7-9, 10-12) and ability level for appropriate instruction and social interaction. Programs include ski instruction, mountain exploration, and fun activities designed to build confidence and love for skiing.

instruction: Do you offer lessons for complete beginners?
output: Absolutely! Our beginner programs are designed specifically for first-time skiers and snowboarders with patient, encouraging instruction on gentle learning terrain. Beginner lessons start with equipment familiarization, basic balance, and safety before progressing to sliding and turning. Our magic carpet lifts eliminate the intimidation of traditional chairlifts for new learners.

instruction: Can I book a private lesson for my family?
output: Yes, family private lessons accommodate up to 4 family members at our standard private lesson rates ($199 for 2-hour, $349 all-day). Family lessons work best when skill levels are similar, though instructors can provide differentiated instruction for mixed abilities. These lessons are popular for families wanting to learn together or parents teaching alongside their children.

instruction: What happens if weather cancels my lesson?
output: Lessons cancelled due to severe weather or mountain closures receive full refunds or can be rescheduled at no charge. Minor weather like light snow or cold temperatures typically don't result in cancellations as they provide excellent learning conditions. Weather cancellation decisions are made by 7:00 AM and communicated via phone, email, and website updates.

instruction: Do you teach racing techniques?
output: Yes, we offer race clinics and advanced technique lessons focusing on carving, gate training, and racing fundamentals. These specialized lessons are available as private instruction or small group clinics for $129 half-day. Race instruction requires intermediate skiing ability and covers topics like course inspection, start technique, and advanced turning mechanics used in competitive skiing.

instruction: What age do kids need to be for ski lessons?
output: Our Kids' Ski School accepts children starting at age 4, as younger children typically lack the physical development and attention span needed for ski instruction. Ages 4-6 focus on basic skills through games and play, while older kids progress through structured skill development. Children under 4 can participate in our daycare program but not formal ski instruction.

instruction: Are there women-only ski lessons available?
output: Yes, we offer women-only group lessons and clinics focusing on building confidence and technique in a supportive environment. These lessons address common concerns like fear, balance, and building strength while skiing. Women-only programs are available by special arrangement and popular during certain promotional weeks throughout the season.

instruction: What should I bring to my ski lesson?
output: Bring weather-appropriate clothing including waterproof jacket and pants, insulated gloves, goggles or sunglasses, and sunscreen. Equipment rental is available if you don't own skis, boots, and helmet. Dress in layers and avoid cotton materials that retain moisture. A small backpack for snacks and water is recommended for all-day lessons.

instruction: Can lessons be customized for specific skills?
output: Yes, private lessons and advanced clinics can be fully customized to focus on specific skills like mogul skiing, powder technique, carving, or terrain park progression. Instructors assess your current ability and design lessons around your goals and areas for improvement. Specialty clinics are also offered throughout the season focusing on particular techniques or terrain types.

instruction: Do you offer beginner snowboard packages?
output: Yes, our snowboard beginner package for $199 includes 2-hour group lesson with AASI certified instructor, full snowboard rental (board, boots, helmet), and beginner area lift access. Snowboard lessons focus on balance, falling safely, and basic turns using our dedicated learning terrain. Package represents excellent value for first-time snowboarders.

instruction: What's the instructor-to-student ratio for kids?
output: Kids' programs maintain maximum 8 children per instructor with additional safety supervisors for younger age groups (4-6 years). Instructor ratios ensure safety while allowing children to learn through play and peer interaction. Advanced kids' groups may have smaller ratios of 4-6 students for more focused instruction on challenging terrain.

instruction: Are there lessons for intermediate skiers?
output: Yes, we offer intermediate group lessons ($89 for 2-hour, $149 all-day) focusing on parallel turns, speed control, and introduction to varied terrain like moguls and steeper slopes. Intermediate lessons help bridge the gap between beginner wedge turns and advanced skiing techniques. Private lessons can address specific intermediate challenges like confidence building or technique refinement.

instruction: Can I take lessons if I haven't skied in years?
output: Absolutely! We offer refresher lessons for returning skiers who want to rebuild confidence and update their technique. Instructors assess your current ability and focus on areas needing improvement while building on existing skills. Many returning skiers benefit from short private lessons to regain confidence before joining group programs.

instruction: What terrain do beginner lessons use?
output: Beginner lessons take place on dedicated learning terrain served by magic carpet lifts and the gentle Meadow Quad chairlift. This area features wide, shallow slopes perfect for learning basic skills safely away from faster traffic. The learning terrain includes multiple slope angles allowing progression from flat areas to gentle hills as skills develop.

instruction: Are there adaptive ski lessons available?
output: Yes, we partner with adaptive ski programs to provide specialized instruction for skiers with disabilities using modified equipment and techniques. Adaptive lessons require advance booking and specialized instructors certified in adaptive methods. Contact our ski school at (970) 555-SNOW to discuss specific needs and arrange appropriate instruction and equipment.

instruction: What happens if I'm not happy with my lesson?
output: Customer satisfaction is our priority, and unsatisfied lesson participants can speak with our ski school supervisor for resolution including lesson replacement, partial refunds, or additional instruction. We work to match students with appropriate instructors and skill-level groups to ensure positive experiences. Feedback helps us continuously improve our instruction programs.

instruction: Do you offer team building ski lessons for groups?
output: Yes, corporate and group team building ski lessons are available for groups of 8 or more with customized programs focusing on communication, trust, and shared challenges. Group lessons can be combined with other resort activities for comprehensive team building experiences. Advanced booking required - call (970) 555-SNOW for group pricing and custom program development.

instruction: Can I continue with the same instructor for multiple lessons?
output: We try to accommodate requests for specific instructors, especially for multi-day packages and private lessons, though availability depends on scheduling and instructor assignments. Consistency helps build rapport and allows instructors to track your progress effectively. Requests for specific instructors should be made when booking and confirmed 24 hours before lessons.

instruction: What's included in advanced skiing clinics?
output: Advanced clinics ($129 half-day) include specialized instruction in techniques like carving, mogul skiing, powder technique, or off-piste skiing with expert-level instructors. Clinics are limited to 4 participants and focus on specific skill development rather than general instruction. Participants should have solid intermediate skills and be comfortable on blue and black terrain.

instruction: Are there teen-specific ski programs?
output: Yes, we offer teen programs (ages 13-17) combining ski instruction with social activities and peer interaction. Teen programs focus on building advanced skills while having fun with peers in age-appropriate groups. These programs are popular during school breaks and can be arranged for multi-day experiences with overnight accommodations.

instruction: What if my child needs a bathroom break during lessons?
output: Kids' lessons include scheduled breaks for bathroom visits, snacks, and rest as needed throughout the day. Instructors are trained to handle children's needs and will escort kids to facilities when necessary. Base Lodge Learning Center is conveniently located near restrooms, dining, and warming areas for easy access during lesson breaks.

instruction: Do you offer video analysis of skiing technique?
output: Video analysis is available through private lessons and advanced clinics where instructors use tablets or phones to record and review technique with students. This technology helps identify areas for improvement and track progress over multiple lessons. Video analysis is particularly effective for advanced skiers working on specific technical elements.

instruction: Can beginners take all-day lessons?
output: Yes, beginner all-day lessons ($149) include morning instruction, lunch break, and afternoon practice time with continued guidance. All-day format allows more time for skill development and confidence building, though some beginners prefer shorter lessons initially. Instructors monitor fatigue levels and adjust intensity throughout the day for optimal learning.

instruction: What's the cancellation policy for ski lessons?
output: Lessons can be cancelled up to 24 hours before the scheduled time for full refund or can be rescheduled based on availability. Cancellations within 24 hours forfeit 50% of lesson fee unless due to documented medical emergency or severe weather. No-shows forfeit the full lesson fee but can apply credit toward future lessons within the season.

instruction: Are there senior-specific ski programs?
output: Yes, we offer senior-friendly programs focusing on technique improvement, confidence building, and skiing within comfort zones rather than aggressive progression. Senior programs emphasize safety, proper warm-up, and enjoying the mountain experience at an appropriate pace. These programs are available through both group lessons and private instruction tailored to mature skiers' needs.

instruction: Do lessons include lift tickets?
output: Beginner packages include restricted lift tickets for learning terrain, while other lesson types require separate lift ticket purchase unless specifically noted. Group and private lessons focus on instruction service only, though lift tickets can be purchased separately at the lesson meeting location. Multi-day lesson packages may include lift ticket discounts.

instruction: What happens if I miss my scheduled lesson?
output: Missed lessons without 24-hour advance notice forfeit the lesson fee, though credit toward future lessons may be available within the current season. Late arrivals may join lessons in progress if safe and appropriate, but lesson time cannot be extended. We recommend arriving 15 minutes early to ensure full lesson participation.

instruction: Are there freestyle/terrain park lessons?
output: Yes, we offer terrain park and freestyle lessons focusing on safe progression through jumps, rails, and other park features. Park lessons require solid intermediate skiing/riding ability and cover topics like speed control, takeoff technique, and landing safely. These specialized lessons are available as private instruction or small group clinics with terrain park certified instructors.

instruction: Can I get a lesson focused just on mogul skiing?
output: Yes, mogul skiing clinics and private lessons are available focusing on technique, line choice, and rhythm needed for bump skiing. Mogul instruction requires solid parallel turning ability and comfort on black diamond terrain. These specialized lessons help skiers develop the skills needed to enjoy our challenging mogul runs throughout the mountain.

instruction: What instruction do you offer for powder skiing?
output: Powder skiing clinics teach techniques for skiing in deep snow including weight distribution, turn initiation, and maintaining rhythm in untracked snow. These lessons require advanced intermediate ability and are typically offered after significant snowfall. Powder instruction helps skiers progress from groomed runs to enjoying our extensive off-piste and backcountry-style terrain.

instruction: Do you have racing camps or intensive programs?
output: Yes, we offer multi-day racing camps during school breaks featuring intensive gate training, video analysis, and competitive coaching. Racing programs require solid intermediate ability and focus on technique development, course strategy, and racing fundamentals. These camps are popular with junior racers and adult recreational racers seeking to improve competitive skills.

instruction: Can I book lessons for large family groups?
output: Large family groups can be accommodated through multiple instructors or specially arranged group lessons when skills levels are similar. Mixed-ability families often benefit from splitting into appropriate skill level groups with reunion times scheduled throughout the day. Contact our ski school at (970) 555-SNOW to arrange family group instruction and pricing.

instruction: What continuing education do your instructors receive?
output: Our instructors participate in ongoing PSIA/AASI education including annual certification updates, specialized clinics, and advanced training programs. Many instructors pursue higher certification levels and specialty endorsements in areas like children's instruction, adaptive skiing, or freestyle. This continuing education ensures current teaching methods and safety standards.

instruction: Are there scholarships or discounts available for lessons?
output: We offer need-based lesson scholarships through our community outreach program for local families and participate in adaptive ski programs providing reduced-cost instruction. Military families receive 15% discounts on lesson programs with valid ID. Contact our ski school directly to inquire about available assistance programs and eligibility requirements.

instruction: What's the difference between group and private lesson instruction?
output: Group lessons provide structured curriculum with peer learning opportunities and are cost-effective for skill development, while private lessons offer customized instruction focused on individual goals and challenges. Private lessons allow flexible pacing and can address specific fears or technical issues more effectively. Both formats use certified instructors and proven teaching progressions.

instruction: Can I switch from ski to snowboard lessons mid-week?
output: Yes, you can switch between ski and snowboard lessons with advance notice, though equipment changes and different learning progressions may require schedule adjustments. Multi-day packages can accommodate sport changes with appropriate pricing adjustments for equipment differences. Some students find learning both sports simultaneously challenging and benefit from focusing on one initially.

instruction: Do you offer lessons during night skiing?
output: Mighty Mountain does not currently offer night skiing, so all lessons take place during regular mountain operating hours 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM. Evening instruction programs may be available during special events or private arrangements. Our lesson schedule maximizes daylight hours and optimal snow conditions for learning.

instruction: What safety measures are included in ski lessons?
output: All lessons include comprehensive safety instruction covering mountain awareness, lift safety, trail etiquette, and emergency procedures. Instructors are trained in first aid and emergency response, and lessons emphasize skiing within ability levels and environmental awareness. Safety equipment including helmets is strongly recommended and available through our rental program.

instruction: Can I get instruction for skiing with my own children?
output: Yes, we offer family instruction programs where parents can learn techniques for safely skiing with their children and teaching basic skills. These lessons focus on communication, safety, and appropriate terrain selection for family skiing. Parent-child instruction helps families enjoy skiing together while maintaining safety and fun for all skill levels.

instruction: Are there any age limits for adult ski lessons?
output: There are no upper age limits for adult ski lessons, and we welcome mature learners of all ages in our programs. Senior-focused instruction addresses specific needs like building confidence, managing physical limitations, and skiing within comfort zones. Our patient, encouraging instructors adapt teaching methods to accommodate different learning styles and physical abilities regardless of age.

instruction: What lodging options do you have at Mighty Mountain?
output: We offer three on-mountain properties: Summit Lodge (ski-in/ski-out luxury), Base Village Hotel (family-friendly with pools and restaurants), and Alpine Suites (budget-friendly condos). Rates range from $150-500/night depending on season and room type. All properties offer complimentary shuttle service and equipment storage. Book online at www.mightymountain.com or call (970) 555-SNOW.

instruction: Which properties offer ski-in/ski-out access?
output: Summit Lodge provides true ski-in/ski-out access with direct trail connections to our main lifts and slopes. Base Village Hotel is ski-adjacent with a 2-minute walk to lifts via heated walkways. Alpine Suites guests can ski to within 100 yards of the property and use our complimentary shuttle for easy lift access.

instruction: What are your most family-friendly lodging options?
output: Base Village Hotel is our premier family destination featuring connecting rooms, kids' activity center, indoor/outdoor pools, and family dining options. The property includes game rooms, movie nights, and supervised children's activities during peak seasons. Family suites accommodate up to 8 guests and include kitchenettes and separate living areas.

instruction: How far in advance should I book lodging?
output: We recommend booking 3-6 months in advance for peak season (December-February) and holidays to guarantee availability and best rates. Off-peak periods typically have availability 30-60 days ahead. Early booking discounts of 10-15% are available for reservations made 90+ days in advance through www.mightymountain.com.

instruction: What luxury amenities are available at Summit Lodge?
output: Summit Lodge features full-service spa, heated outdoor pool and hot tubs, fine dining restaurant, ski concierge, and luxury suites with fireplaces and mountain views. Additional amenities include 24-hour room service, valet parking, equipment tuning service, and private ski lockers. Rates start at $350/night during regular season and $500/night during peak periods.

instruction: Are there any budget-friendly lodging options?
output: Alpine Suites offers our most affordable on-mountain lodging starting at $150/night with studio and one-bedroom condos featuring kitchenettes and mountain views. These self-service accommodations include complimentary WiFi, parking, and shuttle service. Budget travelers can also find partner hotels in Summit Valley starting at $89/night with free resort shuttle service.

instruction: Do you allow pets at your lodging properties?
output: Alpine Suites welcomes pets in designated pet-friendly units for an additional $25/night fee with advance notice and signed pet policy agreement. Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel do not allow pets except registered service animals. Several nearby partner hotels in Summit Valley offer pet-friendly accommodations with shuttle service to the resort.

instruction: What restaurants are available at your lodging properties?
output: Summit Lodge features Elevation Restaurant (fine dining), Base Village Hotel has Mountain View Cafe (casual family dining) and Fireside Lounge, while Alpine Suites provides kitchenettes for self-catering. All properties are within walking distance of additional base area restaurants and bars. Room service is available at Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel until 10 PM.

instruction: How do I make lodging reservations?
output: Reservations can be made online at www.mightymountain.com, by calling (970) 555-SNOW, or through authorized travel partners. Online booking offers real-time availability and instant confirmation with secure payment processing. Group bookings for 5+ rooms should call directly for special rates and coordination.

instruction: What's included in lodging rates?
output: All lodging rates include complimentary WiFi, parking, equipment storage, and resort shuttle service to lifts and village areas. Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel include daily housekeeping, while Alpine Suites offers mid-stay cleaning for stays over 4 nights. Resort fees are not charged - all amenities are included in quoted rates.

instruction: Are there any nearby hotels you recommend?
output: Partner hotels in Summit Valley include Mountain View Inn ($89-129/night), Summit Valley Lodge ($119-179/night), and Powder Peak Hotel ($149-229/night), all offering complimentary shuttle service every 20 minutes. These properties feature pools, restaurants, and family amenities while providing more budget-friendly options. Shuttles run 7 AM-10 PM daily during ski season.

instruction: What are your peak season rates and dates?
output: Peak season runs December 22-January 3, MLK weekend, and Presidents Day weekend with rates 40-60% higher than regular season. Summit Lodge peaks at $500/night, Base Village Hotel at $325/night, and Alpine Suites at $225/night during these periods. Holiday periods require 3-4 night minimum stays and often sell out 6+ months in advance.

instruction: Do you offer long-term stay options?
output: Yes, Alpine Suites offers monthly rates from November-April starting at $3,200/month for studios and $4,800/month for one-bedrooms, including all amenities and utilities. Extended stays of 7+ nights receive 15% discounts at all properties. Seasonal worker housing is available through our employee housing program with separate application process.

instruction: What cancellation policies apply to lodging?
output: Standard cancellations must be made 72 hours before arrival for full refund, while peak season and holiday bookings require 14-day advance cancellation. Cancellation fees of one night's rate apply for late cancellations unless due to documented medical emergencies or resort closure. Travel insurance is recommended for protection against unforeseen cancellation needs.

instruction: Are there spa services available at your properties?
output: Summit Lodge features a full-service spa offering massages, facials, hot stone treatments, and couples packages with mountain views. Base Village Hotel has a smaller spa with massage services and relaxation areas. Spa services can be booked for all resort guests regardless of lodging property through www.mightymountain.com or (970) 555-SNOW.

instruction: What pool and hot tub facilities do you have?
output: Base Village Hotel features indoor and outdoor pools plus three hot tubs including a rooftop hot tub with mountain views. Summit Lodge has a heated outdoor pool, adult-only hot tub, and family hot tub area. Alpine Suites guests have access to Base Village Hotel pool facilities with room key access.

instruction: Do you provide shuttle service from lodging to lifts?
output: All lodging properties include complimentary shuttle service running every 10 minutes from 7:30 AM-5:00 PM during ski season. Summit Lodge guests can ski directly to lifts, while Base Village Hotel is a 2-minute heated walk. Evening shuttle service to village dining and entertainment runs until 11 PM on weekends.

instruction: What room types are available at each property?
output: Summit Lodge offers luxury suites and penthouses (1-4 bedrooms), Base Village Hotel has standard rooms and family suites (1-2 bedrooms), and Alpine Suites provides studio, 1-bedroom, and 2-bedroom condos. All accommodations include mountain or village views, and many feature balconies, fireplaces, and full kitchens. Detailed room descriptions and photos available at www.mightymountain.com.

instruction: Are there any ski packages that include lodging?
output: Yes, we offer ski and stay packages combining lodging, lift tickets, and equipment rentals starting at $189/person/night. Packages include breakfast at Base Village Hotel, equipment storage, and early lift access. Learn-to-ski packages add group lessons for additional $89/person and represent significant savings compared to booking separately.

instruction: What conference and meeting facilities do you have?
output: Base Village Hotel features 3,000 square feet of meeting space including the Summit Ballroom (150 guests) and breakout rooms for 20-50 people. Summit Lodge offers executive meeting rooms and private dining areas for smaller corporate groups. All facilities include AV equipment, catering services, and dedicated event coordination staff.

instruction: Do you have any adults-only accommodations or areas?
output: Summit Lodge features an adults-only floor with exclusive access to the Elevation Lounge and private hot tub area. The property maintains a sophisticated atmosphere while welcoming families in designated areas. Base Village Hotel has adult-only pool hours from 8-10 PM and a 21+ lounge area.

instruction: What activities are available for kids at your lodging?
output: Base Village Hotel offers supervised kids' activities including movie nights, game tournaments, craft time, and outdoor adventures during peak seasons. The property features dedicated kids' pools, playground areas, and game rooms. Kids' activity schedules vary by season and are coordinated with ski school programs for seamless family experiences.

instruction: Are there kitchen facilities in your accommodations?
output: Alpine Suites condos include full kitchens with appliances, cookware, and dining areas, while Base Village Hotel family suites have kitchenettes with mini-fridges and microwaves. Summit Lodge suites feature wet bars and coffee stations but not full cooking facilities. Grocery delivery service is available to all properties through local partners.

instruction: What accessibility features do your properties offer?
output: All properties comply with ADA requirements and offer accessible rooms with roll-in showers, grab bars, and appropriate clearances. Elevator access to all floors, accessible parking spaces, and adaptive equipment storage are available. Advance notice helps ensure appropriate room assignment and any special accommodation needs are met.

instruction: Can I store my ski equipment at the lodging?
output: Yes, all properties provide secure ski storage areas with boot dryers and equipment racks. Summit Lodge offers individual ski lockers with tuning services, while Base Village Hotel and Alpine Suites have shared storage areas with security access. Overnight equipment drying and basic tuning services are available at all locations.

instruction: What fitness facilities are available?
output: Base Village Hotel features a full fitness center with cardio equipment, weights, and yoga studio offering daily classes. Summit Lodge has a smaller fitness room with premium equipment and personal training available. All lodging guests have reciprocal access to fitness facilities regardless of their specific property.

instruction: Are there laundry facilities at your properties?
output: Alpine Suites condos include in-unit washers and dryers, while Base Village Hotel and Summit Lodge offer guest laundry facilities on each floor with complimentary detergent. Same-day laundry and dry cleaning services are available through hotel concierge for additional fees. Extended stay guests receive complimentary weekly laundry service.

instruction: What parking options are available?
output: All properties include complimentary self-parking with covered options available during winter months. Summit Lodge offers valet parking service for $25/night, while Base Village Hotel and Alpine Suites feature convenient self-park structures. RV parking and oversized vehicle accommodation available with advance arrangements.

instruction: Do you offer wedding and special event services?
output: Yes, we specialize in mountain weddings and special events with dedicated event coordinators, catering services, and venue options including outdoor terraces with mountain views. Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel both offer wedding packages including ceremony sites, reception venues, and guest room blocks. Event planning services available year-round for weddings, corporate retreats, and family celebrations.

instruction: What seasonal activities are available beyond skiing?
output: Winter activities include snowshoeing, ice skating, sleigh rides, and spa services, while summer offers mountain biking, hiking, scenic gondola rides, and outdoor concerts. Many activities are included with lodging packages or available at discounted rates for overnight guests. Activity schedules and seasonal offerings vary - check www.mightymountain.com for current programs.

instruction: Are there any loyalty or rewards programs?
output: Our Mountain Rewards program offers points for lodging stays, dining, and activities with benefits including room upgrades, late checkout, and exclusive member events. Points can be redeemed for future stays, lift tickets, and resort services. Membership is complimentary and includes special rates and early access to reservations during peak periods.

instruction: What COVID-19 safety measures are in place?
output: Enhanced cleaning protocols, contactless check-in options, and improved ventilation systems are maintained across all properties. Hand sanitizing stations, flexible cancellation policies, and modified food service procedures ensure guest safety and peace of mind. Current health and safety policies are updated regularly and posted at www.mightymountain.com.

instruction: Can I extend my stay once I'm already checked in?
output: Stay extensions are subject to availability and can be arranged through front desk or concierge services. Extended stays may qualify for additional discounts and include benefits like complimentary late checkout and room service credits. We recommend requesting extensions as early as possible, especially during peak season when availability is limited.

instruction: What is your minimum stay requirement?
output: Regular season has no minimum stay requirements, while peak periods (holidays, powder days) require 2-3 night minimum stays. Holiday weeks typically require 4-7 night minimums with specific arrival and departure dates. Minimum stay policies help ensure availability during high-demand periods and are clearly noted during booking process.

instruction: Do you have any eco-friendly or sustainable lodging practices?
output: All properties participate in environmental sustainability programs including energy-efficient systems, recycling programs, and water conservation measures. Guests can opt for reduced housekeeping services to minimize environmental impact and receive resort credits. Local sourcing for restaurants and eco-friendly amenities are priorities across all lodging operations.

instruction: What concierge services do you provide?
output: Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel offer full concierge services including activity booking, restaurant reservations, transportation arrangements, and local area information. Services include equipment rental coordination, lesson booking, and special occasion arrangements like flowers or champagne delivery. Concierge hours are 7 AM-10 PM daily with emergency assistance available 24/7.

instruction: Are there any age restrictions for certain lodging areas?
output: Summit Lodge maintains adult-preferred areas but welcomes families throughout most of the property with appropriate supervision. Base Village Hotel is fully family-friendly with no age restrictions. Alpine Suites requires guests under 18 to be accompanied by adults but has no specific age limitations for bookings.

instruction: What transportation options are available to/from the airport?
output: Private shuttle service is available from Denver Airport for $89/person each way with advance booking, while rental car facilities and ride-sharing services provide additional options. Group shuttle discounts available for 4+ passengers traveling together. Airport transfer coordination can be arranged through concierge services at time of booking or arrival.

instruction: Can I book activities and lift tickets through the lodging?
output: Yes, all properties offer activity booking services and discounted lift ticket packages for overnight guests. Front desk and concierge can arrange ski lessons, equipment rentals, dining reservations, and off-mountain activities. Package deals combining lodging, lifts, and activities offer significant savings compared to individual bookings.

instruction: What happens if lifts are closed due to weather during my stay?
output: Weather-related lift closures do not automatically qualify for lodging refunds, but we offer alternative activities, spa discounts, and flexible check-out policies to enhance your stay. Indoor activities, fitness facilities, and dining experiences provide excellent alternatives during closure periods. Lift ticket refunds or exchanges may be available separately from lodging arrangements.

instruction: Do you have any romance packages or honeymoon specials?
output: Summit Lodge offers romance packages including couples' spa treatments, champagne and chocolate amenities, late checkout, and mountain view suites with fireplaces. Packages can include private dining experiences, sleigh rides, and other romantic activities. Honeymoon and anniversary packages are available year-round with customizable options based on guest preferences.

instruction: What group booking discounts are available?
output: Groups of 10+ rooms receive progressive discounts starting at 10% off with additional perks like complimentary meeting space, welcome receptions, and group activity coordination. Wedding blocks, corporate groups, and family reunions qualify for special rates and dedicated group coordinators. Group contracts include flexible cancellation terms and payment schedules.

instruction: Are there any lodging options for large families or groups?
output: Alpine Suites offers 2-3 bedroom condos accommodating up to 8 guests, while Base Village Hotel has connecting rooms and family suites for large groups. Summit Lodge penthouses can accommodate up to 12 guests in luxury settings. Group bookings can coordinate multiple adjacent accommodations for reunions, corporate retreats, or extended family vacations.

instruction: What Wi-Fi and technology amenities are available?
output: All properties offer complimentary high-speed Wi-Fi throughout the facilities, smart TV systems with streaming capabilities, and in-room charging stations. Business centers with computers and printing services are available at Summit Lodge and Base Village Hotel. Technical support and connectivity assistance available through front desk services 24/7.

instruction: Can I check in early or check out late?
output: Early check-in and late checkout are available subject to availability with potential fees during peak periods. Mountain Rewards members and suite guests receive complimentary late checkout until 2 PM. Luggage storage and shower facilities are available for guests arriving early or departing late to maximize mountain time.

instruction: What seasonal employment housing do you offer?
output: Seasonal worker housing is available through separate application process for resort employees with shared accommodations starting at $400/month including utilities and internet. Employee housing includes recreational facilities, shuttle service, and meal plan options. Applications are accepted beginning in September for winter season positions with priority given to returning employees.

instruction: What dining options do you have on the mountain?
output: Mighty Mountain offers five dining locations: Summit Bistro (fine dining with mountain views), Base Lodge Cafe (casual family dining), Mid-Mountain Grill (quick service), Grab & Go Market (sandwiches and snacks), and The Aprs Lounge (drinks and appetizers). Most locations open at 7 AM for breakfast with entrees ranging $12-35. Reservations recommended for Summit Bistro.

instruction: What are your restaurant hours during ski season?
output: Most dining locations open at 7:00 AM for breakfast service and close at 9:00 PM. Summit Bistro operates 11:00 AM-9:00 PM for lunch and dinner, while Mid-Mountain Grill runs 8:00 AM-4:00 PM matching lift hours. The Aprs Lounge opens at 3:00 PM and stays open until 11:00 PM for evening drinks and light fare.

instruction: Do you accept reservations at your restaurants?
output: Reservations are required for Summit Bistro and can be made online or by calling (970) 555-SNOW up to 30 days in advance. Base Lodge Cafe and other locations operate on a first-come, first-served basis but offer call-ahead seating during peak lunch hours (11:30 AM-1:30 PM). Large groups of 8+ can make reservations at any location with advance notice.

instruction: What type of food does Summit Bistro serve?
output: Summit Bistro offers upscale mountain cuisine featuring Colorado beef, fresh seafood, and seasonal ingredients with spectacular views from 12,408 feet elevation. Menu items include elk medallions ($35), pan-seared salmon ($28), and house-made pasta ($24) with an extensive wine list. The restaurant emphasizes local sourcing and changes menus seasonally to reflect fresh, available ingredients.

instruction: Are there quick dining options for skiers in a hurry?
output: Yes, Grab & Go Market offers pre-made sandwiches, salads, soups, and snacks perfect for on-the-go dining with prices from $8-15. Mid-Mountain Grill provides fast-casual service with burgers, pizza, and hot sandwiches ready in 5-10 minutes. Both locations feature grab-and-go beverages, energy bars, and trail snacks for easy slope-side dining.

instruction: What breakfast options are available?
output: Base Lodge Cafe serves full breakfast from 7:00 AM including made-to-order omelets ($12), pancakes ($10), breakfast burritos ($11), and continental options. Grab & Go Market offers quick breakfast items like muffins, yogurt parfaits, breakfast sandwiches, and premium coffee starting at $4. Hot breakfast is available until 11:00 AM at most locations.

instruction: Do you have kids' menus and family-friendly dining?
output: All restaurants offer kids' menus with items under $10 including chicken tenders, mac and cheese, pizza, and grilled cheese with fruit and milk options. Base Lodge Cafe is our most family-friendly location with high chairs, coloring activities, and a relaxed atmosphere. Kids under 5 eat free from the kids' menu with paying adult entree at Base Lodge Cafe on Sundays.

instruction: What are your most popular lunch items?
output: Our signature Mountain Burger ($16) at Base Lodge Cafe and the Colorado Green Chile ($14) are guest favorites, along with fresh pizza at Mid-Mountain Grill ($12-18). Summit Bistro's lunch feature includes gourmet sandwiches ($18-22) and seasonal salads ($16-20). Most locations offer daily specials featuring local ingredients and seasonal preparations.

instruction: Can you accommodate food allergies and dietary restrictions?
output: Yes, all kitchens can accommodate common allergies and dietary needs including gluten-free, vegetarian, vegan, and dairy-free options clearly marked on menus. Chefs can modify most dishes to meet specific requirements with advance notice. Detailed ingredient information is available from servers, and separate preparation areas prevent cross-contamination for severe allergies.

instruction: What alcoholic beverages do you serve?
output: The Aprs Lounge features full bar service with craft cocktails, local Colorado beers, and wines with mountain views and live music on weekends. All restaurants serve beer and wine, while Summit Bistro offers an extensive wine list with sommelier recommendations. Aprs-ski drink specials run 3:00-6:00 PM daily with discounted drinks and appetizers.

instruction: Are there vegetarian and vegan options?
output: Every restaurant offers multiple vegetarian options, and Summit Bistro and Base Lodge Cafe feature dedicated vegan entrees including quinoa bowls ($16), veggie burgers ($14), and seasonal plant-based specials. Grab & Go Market stocks vegan sandwiches, salads, and snacks daily. All plant-based options are clearly labeled on menus and prepared in dedicated areas.

instruction: What are your busiest dining times?
output: Peak dining times are 11:30 AM-1:30 PM for lunch and 6:00-8:00 PM for dinner, especially on weekends and holidays. We recommend arriving before 11:30 AM or after 2:00 PM for shorter wait times at popular locations. Breakfast is busiest 8:00-9:30 AM, while aprs-ski crowds gather 3:30-5:30 PM at The Aprs Lounge.

instruction: Do you offer catering services for groups?
output: Yes, we provide catering for groups of 15+ including boxed lunches, buffet service, and custom menus for corporate events, ski clubs, and family gatherings. Catering can be delivered to meeting rooms, outdoor venues, or served at designated dining areas. Advanced booking required - call (970) 555-SNOW to discuss menu options and pricing for your group size.

instruction: What grab-and-go snacks are available?
output: Grab & Go Market stocks energy bars, trail mix, fresh fruit, sandwiches, cookies, chips, and hot/cold beverages perfect for on-mountain fuel. Items range from $3-12 and include both healthy options and indulgent treats. The market also carries ski essentials like hand warmers, lip balm, and sunscreen for convenience.

instruction: Are there gluten-free menu options?
output: All restaurants offer gluten-free options including dedicated gluten-free pizza at Mid-Mountain Grill, gluten-free pasta at Summit Bistro, and certified gluten-free bread for sandwiches. Base Lodge Cafe features gluten-free pancakes and omelets prepared with separate equipment. Gluten-free items are marked with symbols on all menus and prepared with strict protocols.

instruction: What coffee and beverage options do you have?
output: Premium coffee service is available at all locations featuring locally roasted beans, espresso drinks, specialty lattes, and hot chocolate made with real chocolate. Grab & Go Market offers the widest selection including cold brew, energy drinks, smoothies, and fresh juices. Hot beverages range $3-6 with free refills on drip coffee.

instruction: Do you serve late-night dining?
output: The Aprs Lounge serves light fare including appetizers, flatbreads, and desserts until 11:00 PM, while other dining locations close by 9:00 PM. Late-night menu features shareable plates ($8-16) perfect for aprs-ski socializing. Room service is available for Summit Lodge guests until 10:00 PM with limited menu options.

instruction: What are your price ranges for meals?
output: Breakfast items range $4-15, lunch $8-25, and dinner entrees $12-35 depending on location and selection. Summit Bistro represents our highest-end pricing ($18-35 entrees) while Grab & Go Market offers the most budget-friendly options ($3-12). Most locations fall in the mid-range with quality meals $12-20 including sides.

instruction: Do you have outdoor dining options?
output: Summit Bistro features a heated outdoor deck at 12,408 feet with panoramic mountain views, while Base Lodge Cafe has a sunny patio with umbrella seating. Mid-Mountain Grill offers picnic-style outdoor seating with mountain vistas. Outdoor dining is weather-dependent and typically available during warmer periods and sunny days.

instruction: What dessert options do you offer?
output: Summit Bistro creates house-made desserts including chocolate lava cake ($12), seasonal fruit tarts ($10), and Colorado honey ice cream ($8). Base Lodge Cafe offers family favorites like cookies, brownies, and ice cream sundaes ($4-8). The Aprs Lounge features dessert cocktails and sweet treats perfect for sharing after a day on the slopes.

instruction: Are there any signature dishes or local specialties?
output: Our Colorado Green Chile appears on menus throughout the resort and is made with locally sourced Hatch chiles, while our Mountain Burger features Colorado beef and local cheese. Summit Bistro's elk medallions showcase regional game, and our house-made Rocky Road ice cream uses Colorado chocolate. These dishes celebrate local flavors and ingredients unique to our region.

instruction: Can I make special dietary requests when ordering?
output: Yes, our kitchen staff can accommodate most dietary requests including modifications for allergies, religious requirements, and personal preferences. We recommend informing servers of any restrictions when ordering, and advance notice helps ensure proper preparation. Chefs are experienced with common modifications and happy to adapt dishes to meet your needs.

instruction: What entertainment do you offer during dining?
output: The Aprs Lounge features live acoustic music Thursday-Sunday evenings and hosts trivia nights on Tuesdays during peak season. Summit Bistro occasionally offers wine tastings and chef's table experiences with advance reservations. Base Lodge Cafe provides family-friendly atmosphere with kids' activities and games during busy periods.

instruction: Do you accept credit cards and what payment methods?
output: All dining locations accept major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover), cash, and mobile payments like Apple Pay and Google Pay. Resort gift cards and employee meal cards are also accepted at all locations. Tips can be added to credit card payments or left in cash for excellent service.

instruction: Are there healthy menu options available?
output: Yes, every restaurant features healthy choices including fresh salads, grilled proteins, quinoa bowls, and seasonal vegetables clearly marked on menus. Grab & Go Market stocks organic options, fresh fruit, yogurt parfaits, and protein boxes for health-conscious diners. Nutritional information is available upon request for menu planning.

instruction: What are your soup and salad offerings?
output: Daily soup selections include classics like chicken noodle and tomato bisque plus seasonal specialties like wild mushroom and butternut squash ($6-8). Fresh salads range from simple greens ($12) to signature creations like the Summit Cobb ($18) with locally sourced ingredients. Soup and salad combinations offer lighter meal options at reduced pricing.

instruction: Do you offer pizza and Italian food?
output: Mid-Mountain Grill specializes in wood-fired pizza with traditional and gourmet toppings ($12-18), while Summit Bistro features house-made pasta dishes with seasonal sauces ($18-24). Pizza options include gluten-free crusts and vegan cheese alternatives. Italian-inspired dishes use fresh herbs and local ingredients when possible.

instruction: What breakfast beverages do you serve?
output: Morning beverage options include premium coffee, espresso drinks, fresh orange juice, smoothies, and hot chocolate at all breakfast locations. Base Lodge Cafe offers bottomless coffee with breakfast entrees, while Grab & Go Market features grab-and-go coffee in various sizes. Fresh-squeezed juices and specialty breakfast drinks are available for $3-6.

instruction: Are there options for large groups or events?
output: Yes, we offer group dining packages, private dining rooms, and buffet-style service for groups of 15 or more. Summit Bistro has a private dining room for up to 24 guests, while Base Lodge Cafe can accommodate larger groups with advance arrangements. Custom menus, special pricing, and dedicated service staff are available for group events.

instruction: What hot beverages do you serve besides coffee?
output: Hot beverage selections include premium hot chocolate made with real chocolate, specialty teas, chai lattes, apple cider, and seasonal drinks like peppermint mochas. The Aprs Lounge features spiked hot chocolate and warm cocktails perfect for cold mountain days. Hot beverages range $3-7 and are available at all dining locations throughout the day.

instruction: Do you have sandwich and wrap options?
output: Grab & Go Market offers pre-made sandwiches and wraps ($8-12) including turkey club, veggie wraps, and grilled paninis, while Base Lodge Cafe prepares made-to-order sandwiches and burgers. Options include gluten-free bread, vegan proteins, and custom combinations. Most sandwiches come with chips or fresh fruit.

instruction: What are your appetizer and small plate options?
