output: Cultural entertainment includes storytelling evenings featuring local legends and mountain folklore, acoustic music sessions with Colorado musicians, and presentations about regional history and geology. Guest speakers share adventures, mountain rescue stories, and environmental conservation topics in intimate settings. These programs typically occur 2-3 times weekly in the Summit House meeting room with complimentary attendance.

instruction: Are there any volunteer or community service opportunities?
output: Volunteer opportunities include trail maintenance projects, wildlife habitat restoration, and community ski programs for underprivileged youth during designated service days. Environmental stewardship programs allow guests to participate in conservation efforts and learn about mountain ecosystem protection. Service projects are coordinated with local organizations and provide meaningful ways for visitors to give back to the community.

instruction: What exclusive or VIP experiences can I book?
output: VIP experiences include private gondola cars with champagne service, exclusive access to hidden terrain with personal guides, luxury spa packages with private treatment rooms, and chef's table experiences at Summit Bistro. Helicopter access to remote dining locations and private mountain tours with professional photographers create once-in-a-lifetime memories. VIP packages start at $500/person and require advance booking with customization available.

instruction: How do I book activities and what are your cancellation policies?
output: Book activities online at www.mightymountain.com, call (970) 555-SNOW, or visit guest services desks at Base Lodge and Mid-Mountain Lodge during operating hours. Most activities can be cancelled 24 hours in advance for full refund, while weather-related cancellations receive automatic refunds or rescheduling options. Group activities and exclusive experiences may have different cancellation terms outlined at time of booking.

instruction: Do you have WiFi and charging stations?
output: Free WiFi is available throughout Mighty Mountain resort including all lodge areas, restaurants, and outdoor plazas with network name 'MightyMountain_Guest'. Phone charging stations are located in the Base Lodge main atrium, Mid-Mountain Lodge, and Summit House with multiple cable types available. Guest services can provide additional charging cables for most devices if needed.

instruction: Where can I find ATMs and banking services?
output: Three ATMs are conveniently located in the Base Lodge main atrium, near the food court, and outside the ticket office for easy access. All ATMs accept major bank cards and provide cash in $20 denominations with standard ATM fees applied. Guest services can assist with banking information and directions to full-service banks in Summit Valley if needed.

instruction: What locker and storage options do you have?
output: Day lockers are available for $8/day in multiple sizes at Base Lodge, Mid-Mountain Lodge, and near lift terminals for storing personal items, extra clothing, and gear. Season lockers cost $25 for the entire ski season and are located in heated areas of Base Lodge with 24/7 access. Ski storage areas with boot dryers are available at all lodge locations at no additional charge.

instruction: Where are restrooms located and are they accessible?
output: Restrooms are located on every floor of Base Lodge, at Mid-Mountain Lodge, Summit House, and near all major lift terminals throughout the mountain. All facilities are ADA compliant with accessible stalls, grab bars, and automatic doors where applicable. Family restrooms with baby changing stations are available at Base Lodge and Mid-Mountain Lodge for convenience.

instruction: Do you have baby changing facilities?
output: Baby changing stations are located in all main restrooms plus dedicated family restrooms at Base Lodge (both floors) and Mid-Mountain Lodge. The Base Lodge Kids' Zone includes a private nursing/changing room with comfortable seating, electrical outlets, and privacy locks. Diaper disposal and hand sanitizing stations are provided at all changing areas.

instruction: What retail shops do you have in the village?
output: The Mountain Gear Shop offers ski equipment, apparel, goggles, and accessories from top brands, while the Summit Gift Store features souvenirs, Colorado products, and resort merchandise. The Base Lodge Convenience Market provides snacks, beverages, basic toiletries, and forgotten essentials like gloves and hand warmers. All shops are located in Base Lodge with hours matching resort operations.

instruction: Where can I buy lift tickets?
output: Lift tickets are available at the Base Lodge ticket office (main location), Mid-Mountain Lodge satellite window, and automated kiosks near the main entrance. Online purchases at www.mightymountain.com offer $10 savings and faster service with mobile tickets or will-call pickup. Ticket offices open at 7:30 AM daily with extended hours during peak periods.

instruction: What guest services do you provide?
output: Guest services desks at Base Lodge (main) and Mid-Mountain Lodge (satellite) provide information, assistance, problem resolution, and activity bookings from 8 AM-6 PM daily. Services include lost and found, lift ticket issues, restaurant reservations, activity planning, and general resort information. Multilingual staff are available during peak season to assist international guests.

instruction: What accessibility services and equipment do you offer?
output: Accessibility services include wheelchair rentals, adaptive ski equipment through partnerships, priority parking, and accessible shuttle service with advance notice. All buildings feature elevator access, ramps, accessible restrooms, and designated seating areas in restaurants. Contact guest services at (970) 555-SNOW to arrange accessibility accommodations and specialized equipment needs.

instruction: Are there places to sit and relax indoors?
output: Indoor seating areas include the Base Lodge main atrium with comfortable chairs and mountain views, quiet lounges on upper floors, and designated rest areas near restaurants and shops. The Summit House features panoramic viewing areas with heated seating and floor-to-ceiling windows. All seating areas offer free WiFi and are accessible to guests regardless of dining or shopping purchases.

instruction: What convenience items can I purchase if I forgot something?
output: The Base Lodge Convenience Market stocks forgotten essentials including gloves, hand warmers, lip balm, sunscreen, basic medications, snacks, and beverages. The Mountain Gear Shop provides technical items like goggles, neck gaiters, ski socks, and basic repair supplies. Emergency items like first aid supplies are available through guest services at no charge.

instruction: Do you have business services like printing or internet access?
output: Business services are available at guest services including printing, copying, faxing, and high-speed internet access at dedicated workstations in Base Lodge. Conference rooms with AV equipment can be reserved for business meetings or presentations. Executive lounges in Summit Lodge provide quiet workspace with premium WiFi and business amenities for registered guests.

instruction: Where can I get information about local area attractions?
output: Guest services provides comprehensive information about Summit Valley attractions, dining, lodging, and activities including maps, brochures, and local recommendations. Information displays in Base Lodge feature current events, weather conditions, and area activities updated daily. Staff can arrange transportation, make reservations, and provide directions to local attractions and services.

instruction: What retail items and souvenirs are available?
output: The Summit Gift Store offers Mighty Mountain branded apparel, Colorado-themed gifts, local artisan products, and traditional ski resort souvenirs including t-shirts, hoodies, mugs, and ornaments. Higher-end items include handcrafted jewelry, local artwork, and premium Colorado products like specialty foods and craft beverages. Custom embroidery services available for personalizing apparel purchases.

instruction: Are there any postal or shipping services?
output: Guest services provides basic postal services including stamp sales and mail posting, while shipping services for larger items like ski equipment purchases can be arranged through retail shops. FedEx and UPS pickup services are available for outgoing packages with advance arrangement. The nearest full-service post office is located 5 miles away in Summit Valley.

instruction: What are your lost and found procedures and locations?
output: Lost and found is located at Base Lodge guest services operating 8 AM-6 PM daily, with satellite services at Mid-Mountain Lodge during peak hours. Items are catalogued and held for 90 days with valuable items requiring ID verification for pickup. Online lost and found reporting available at www.mightymountain.com with email notifications when items are located.

instruction: Do you have coat check or gear storage services?
output: Complimentary coat racks are available throughout all lodge areas, while secure day storage for valuable items requires paid lockers ($8/day). Ski and snowboard storage with boot dryers is provided free at all lodge entrances and near lift terminals. Valet ski storage with daily tuning services is available at Summit Lodge for premium guests.

instruction: What first aid and medical supplies are available?
output: Basic first aid supplies including bandages, pain relievers, and cold packs are available free through guest services and ski patrol stations. The Base Lodge medical clinic provides professional medical care 8 AM-4 PM daily with certified medical staff. Emergency medical supplies and AED units are strategically located throughout all lodge facilities.

instruction: Are there quiet areas for children or nursing mothers?
output: The Base Lodge Kids' Zone includes a quiet room with comfortable seating, privacy locks, and electrical outlets designed for nursing mothers and tired children. Additional quiet areas are located on upper floors of Base Lodge away from main traffic areas. The Summit House provides peaceful spaces with mountain views for relaxation and family time.

instruction: What currency exchange or payment options do you accept?
output: All resort services accept major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover), cash (US dollars), and mobile payments like Apple Pay and Google Pay. Limited foreign currency exchange is available through guest services for major currencies. Resort gift cards provide convenient payment options and make excellent gifts for visitors.

instruction: Do you have vehicle services like jump starts or lockout assistance?
output: Basic vehicle assistance including jump starts, lockout help, and snow removal is provided free by resort maintenance during operating hours. Guest services can coordinate with local towing services for major mechanical issues or after-hours emergencies. Parking attendants patrol lots during peak periods and can provide immediate assistance for minor vehicle problems.

instruction: What hours do village services operate?
output: Most village services operate 8 AM-6 PM daily including guest services, retail shops, and information desks, with extended hours during peak periods and holidays. Lockers and ski storage are accessible 24/7, while ATMs provide round-the-clock banking services. Restaurant and dining hours vary by location - check with guest services for current operating schedules.

instruction: Are there places to buy or rent books, magazines, or entertainment?
output: The Summit Gift Store carries a selection of books about skiing, Colorado history, and mountain adventures, plus current magazines and local newspapers. Free reading materials including resort magazines and area guides are available in lodge seating areas. The Base Lodge library corner offers book exchanges where guests can trade reading materials with other visitors.

instruction: What technology support do you provide?
output: Technology support includes device charging stations, WiFi troubleshooting, and basic technical assistance through guest services during operating hours. IT support staff can help with connectivity issues, device setup for resort services, and troubleshooting common technology problems. Emergency communication devices are available for guests venturing into backcountry areas.

instruction: Do you have any social or community gathering spaces?
output: Community gathering spaces include the Base Lodge main atrium with comfortable seating and mountain views, outdoor plaza areas with fire pits and seating during good weather, and The Aprs Lounge for socializing and entertainment. Designated quiet zones provide spaces for reading and relaxation, while activity areas accommodate games and children's entertainment. All spaces welcome resort guests and day visitors.

instruction: What is your refund policy for lift tickets?
output: Lift tickets can be refunded in full if cancelled within 24 hours of purchase. If Mighty Mountain closes due to weather or mechanical issues, we provide full refunds or rain checks valid for the remainder of the season. Partial day refunds are available if you're injured and provide medical documentation. Contact guest services at (970) 555-SNOW for refund requests.

instruction: What happens if the resort closes due to weather?
output: If Mighty Mountain closes completely due to severe weather, all guests receive full refunds or rain checks valid for any future day of the current season. If lifts operate for less than 4 hours due to weather, partial refunds or rain checks are automatically issued. Weather closure decisions prioritize guest safety and are announced by 7 AM when possible through our website and snow phone.

instruction: What are the skiing responsibility code rules?
output: All skiers must follow the Skiing Responsibility Code including staying in control at all times, yielding to downhill skiers, stopping only where visible to others, and observing all posted signs and warnings. Reckless skiing, skiing while intoxicated, or violating safety rules may result in lift ticket revocation and removal from the mountain. Repeat offenders face permanent resort bans and potential legal action for endangering other guests.

instruction: Can I take photos and videos on the mountain?
output: Personal photography and filming for non-commercial use is allowed throughout the resort, but please be respectful of other guests' privacy and safety. Commercial filming, drone usage, or professional photography requires advance permits and insurance through our marketing department at (970) 555-SNOW. Action cameras and personal devices are welcome, but users assume all risks for equipment damage or loss.

instruction: Can I bring my own food and drinks?
output: Outside food and non-alcoholic beverages are allowed in designated picnic areas and outdoor seating zones only, not inside lodge facilities or restaurants. Alcoholic beverages from outside sources are prohibited throughout the resort property. Glass containers are not permitted anywhere on the mountain for safety reasons. Coolers and picnic items must be stored in designated areas only.

instruction: What are your smoking and alcohol policies?
output: Smoking and vaping are only permitted in designated outdoor smoking areas near lodge entrances, never on lifts, trails, or indoor facilities. Alcohol service is restricted to licensed areas including restaurants and The Aprs Lounge, with consumption not permitted on slopes or lifts. Public intoxication may result in lift ticket revocation and removal from the resort. All tobacco products must be properly disposed of in provided receptacles.

instruction: Are pets allowed at the resort?
output: Pets are not allowed on ski slopes, lifts, or in lodge facilities for safety and health regulations, except for certified service animals assisting guests with disabilities. Service animals must be under control, properly identified, and current on vaccinations with documentation available upon request. Pet boarding services are available in Summit Valley - contact guest services for local referrals and information.

instruction: What liability do I assume by skiing here?
output: All guests assume inherent risks of skiing and snowboarding by purchasing lift tickets and must sign liability waivers acknowledging these dangers. Mighty Mountain is not liable for injuries resulting from normal skiing hazards, weather conditions, or guest negligence, but maintains insurance for facility-related incidents. Waivers do not eliminate resort responsibility for gross negligence or facility maintenance failures.

instruction: What if I damage rental equipment?
output: Customers are responsible for repair or replacement costs of damaged rental equipment, with a $50 deductible for minor damage when damage protection insurance ($8/day) is purchased. Without insurance, customers pay full repair or replacement costs ranging from $100-800 depending on equipment and damage severity. Normal wear from skiing is expected, but negligent damage or misuse results in additional charges.

instruction: How do you protect my personal information and privacy?
output: Mighty Mountain follows strict privacy policies protecting guest information collected through reservations, purchases, and resort services in compliance with applicable privacy laws. Personal data is used only for resort operations and communications, never sold to third parties without consent. Guests can request data deletion or review collected information by contacting guest services at (970) 555-SNOW.

instruction: Do you require age verification for certain activities?
output: Age verification with valid photo ID is required for alcohol purchases, terrain park access (minimum age 12), and certain guided activities with age restrictions. Minors under 18 require parent/guardian signatures on liability waivers and may need adult supervision for specific activities. Fake IDs result in immediate lift ticket revocation and potential legal consequences under Colorado law.

instruction: What is your policy on lost or stolen items?
output: Mighty Mountain is not responsible for lost, stolen, or damaged personal property anywhere on resort grounds, and guests should secure valuable items in lockers or leave them in accommodations. Lost items should be reported immediately to guest services with detailed descriptions for our lost and found service. Found items are held for 90 days, and valuable items require ID verification for pickup.

instruction: Can I exchange or transfer my lift ticket to someone else?
output: Lift tickets are non-transferable and must be used by the original purchaser with valid photo ID required for ticket pickup and random verification checks. Season passes include photos and are strictly non-transferable with penalties including pass revocation for violations. Ticket exchanges for different dates are available up to 24 hours before the original date for a $15 processing fee.

instruction: What happens if I'm caught skiing without a valid lift ticket?
output: Skiing without a valid lift ticket is considered theft of services and results in immediate ejection from the resort, confiscation of equipment until payment, and potential prosecution under Colorado law. Offenders must pay full lift ticket price plus a $100 penalty fee before equipment return. Repeat violations result in permanent resort bans and criminal charges filed with local authorities.

instruction: What are your policies regarding inappropriate behavior?
output: Harassment, discrimination, inappropriate language, or disruptive behavior toward other guests or staff results in immediate removal from the resort without refund. All guests must treat others with respect regardless of race, gender, religion, or ability level in accordance with Colorado civil rights laws. Violent behavior or threats result in immediate police involvement and permanent resort bans with prosecution to the full extent of the law.

instruction: Can I bring outside alcohol for special events or groups?
output: Outside alcohol is prohibited throughout resort property due to liquor licensing laws and liability concerns, even for private groups or special events. All alcohol must be purchased through licensed resort facilities with proper service protocols and consumption restrictions. Special event alcohol service can be arranged through our catering department with proper permits and supervision requirements.

instruction: What is your policy on equipment theft or security?
output: While Mighty Mountain provides ski storage areas and security patrols, guests are responsible for securing their equipment and the resort is not liable for theft or vandalism. Equipment should be locked when possible and never left unattended in unsecured areas overnight. Report suspected theft immediately to ski patrol or guest services for investigation and police reporting assistance.

instruction: Are there restrictions on what I can wear while skiing?
output: While no formal dress code exists, appropriate winter clothing is required for safety and comfort, with helmets strongly recommended for all activities. Offensive clothing with inappropriate language or imagery may result in requests to change or cover items. Proper footwear is required in all lodge facilities for safety and cleanliness reasons. Ski boots are not permitted in restaurants or retail areas.

instruction: What happens if I violate resort policies?
output: Policy violations may result in warnings, lift ticket suspension, ejection from the resort, or permanent bans depending on severity and repeat offenses. Serious violations including safety infractions, theft, or threatening behavior result in immediate removal and potential legal action. All enforcement decisions are final, and refunds are not provided for policy violations resulting in ejection or suspension.

instruction: Do you have policies about social media and online reviews?
output: Guests are free to share their experiences on social media and review platforms, and we encourage honest feedback about resort services and facilities. However, posting false information, defamatory content, or inappropriate images of other guests without consent may result in legal action. We reserve the right to respond publicly to inaccurate reviews with factual corrections.

instruction: What are your policies regarding medical emergencies?
output: Medical emergencies receive immediate response from certified ski patrol and medical staff regardless of guest ability to pay for treatment. Basic emergency care is provided free, though transportation to hospitals and extended medical care may incur charges covered by guest insurance. Guests with serious medical conditions should inform staff and consider medical travel insurance for comprehensive coverage.

instruction: Can I modify or cancel my reservation?
output: Reservations for lodging, dining, and activities can be modified or cancelled according to specific policies for each service, typically requiring 24-72 hours advance notice for full refunds. Peak period reservations may have stricter cancellation policies with partial penalties for late cancellations. Contact the appropriate department or guest services at (970) 555-SNOW for specific cancellation terms and procedures.

instruction: What is your policy on weapons and dangerous items?
output: Weapons of any kind including firearms, knives, pepper spray, and other dangerous items are strictly prohibited on resort property and result in immediate ejection and police involvement. This policy applies to all areas including parking lots, lodging, and outdoor spaces for the safety of all guests and staff. Exceptions are made only for certified law enforcement officers with proper identification and authorization.

instruction: Do you have policies about environmental protection?
output: Guests must follow Leave No Trace principles by properly disposing of trash, staying on designated trails, and not disturbing wildlife or natural features. Littering results in fines and cleanup fees, while damage to natural resources may result in ejection and restitution costs. We encourage environmental stewardship and provide recycling facilities throughout the resort for responsible waste disposal.

instruction: What happens if I have a dispute with resort staff or policies?
output: Guest complaints and disputes should be reported immediately to guest services management for investigation and resolution, with most issues resolved within 24 hours. Formal complaint procedures are available through our website or guest services, with executive management review for unresolved issues. We strive for fair resolution and guest satisfaction while maintaining necessary safety and operational policies.

instruction: When does your ski season typically run?
output: Mighty Mountain's ski season typically runs from mid-November through mid-April, weather and snow conditions permitting. Early season (November-December) offers limited terrain as we build base depths, while peak season (January-March) features full mountain access. Spring skiing (March-April) provides longer days, warmer weather, and corn snow conditions. Check www.mightymountain.com for current season status.

instruction: What should I expect during early season skiing?
output: Early season conditions (mid-November through December) typically feature limited terrain with 30-50% of trails open as we build base depths and open runs progressively. Expect variable snow conditions, possible weather delays, and shorter operating hours as snowmaking operations continue. Value season pricing ($89/day) makes early season an affordable time to ski, though high-elevation and expert terrain may not be available until later in the season.

instruction: What are the benefits and challenges of spring skiing?
output: Spring skiing (March-April) offers warmer temperatures, longer daylight hours, and excellent corn snow conditions that soften during the day and freeze overnight. Benefits include value pricing, fewer crowds, and perfect weather for outdoor dining and aprs-ski activities. Challenges include variable snow conditions, potential early closure of high-elevation terrain, and the need for sunscreen due to intense UV reflection off snow.

instruction: What summer activities do you offer when skiing ends?
output: Summer operations (June-September) feature scenic gondola rides, mountain biking on 25+ trails, hiking access to alpine lakes, and the popular alpine slide for family fun. Additional activities include outdoor concerts, food festivals, photography workshops, and guided nature tours. Summer lift tickets provide access to hiking trails and mountain restaurants, with different pricing and schedules than winter operations.

instruction: What maintenance and improvements happen during the off-season?
output: Off-season maintenance includes comprehensive lift inspections and repairs, trail improvements, snowmaking system upgrades, and facility renovations to enhance guest experience. Major projects like new lifts, restaurant renovations, or terrain expansion are typically completed during summer months. These improvements ensure safe, reliable operations and often include sustainability initiatives and technology upgrades announced each fall.

instruction: Do season passes have blackout dates?
output: Our Summit Pass ($1,299) has no blackout dates and provides unlimited skiing throughout the season. The Mighty Pass ($899) excludes Christmas week, New Year's week, MLK weekend, and Presidents Day weekend. The Weekday Pass ($599) is valid Monday-Friday only, excluding holidays. All passes include benefits like priority parking, equipment discounts, and early season access.

instruction: When are your busiest times and holiday crowds?
output: Peak crowds occur during Christmas week (December 22-January 2), MLK weekend, Presidents Day weekend, and spring break periods in March. These periods feature peak pricing, longer lift lines, and require advance planning for parking, dining, and lodging. Holiday periods may have 3-4 night minimum stays and often sell out months in advance for on-mountain accommodations.

instruction: What are typical weather patterns throughout the season?
output: November-December features cold temperatures and variable snowfall as the base builds, January-February brings the coldest temps and heaviest snowfall, while March-April offers warmer days with cold nights creating excellent spring conditions. Storm cycles typically last 2-3 days followed by clear, cold periods perfect for skiing. Altitude creates significant temperature differences between base (9,280 ft) and summit (12,408 ft) elevations.

instruction: When is the best time to visit for powder skiing?
output: January through early March typically provides the best powder skiing opportunities with cold temperatures preserving snow quality and frequent storm cycles. Mid-week visits offer the best chance of fresh tracks and fewer crowds on powder days. Subscribe to our powder alerts at www.mightymountain.com to receive notifications when we get 6+ inches of overnight snowfall.

instruction: What's the best time to visit to avoid crowds?
output: Mid-week skiing (Tuesday-Thursday) from January-March offers the best combination of good snow conditions and smaller crowds. Early season (November-December) and late season (April) also feature fewer people but may have limited terrain availability. Avoiding major holidays and school vacation weeks significantly reduces crowd levels and improves the overall skiing experience.

instruction: When can I find the best deals and value pricing?
output: Value season pricing ($89/day) is available during early season (November-December 21) and late season (late March-April closing), offering significant savings on lift tickets. Multi-day packages, season passes purchased early, and midweek visits provide additional savings. Spring skiing combines value pricing with excellent weather and snow conditions for budget-conscious visitors.

instruction: What special events happen at the end of the season?
output: End-of-season events include Closing Day Celebration with live music, BBQ, and giveaways, plus Spring Festival featuring outdoor activities, equipment sales, and appreciation events for season pass holders. Pond skimming contests, costume competitions, and aprs-ski parties celebrate the season's end. Many events are free for lift ticket holders and create festive atmospheres during final weeks.

instruction: How reliable is your season opening date?
output: While we target November 15 opening, actual dates depend on natural snowfall and temperatures for snowmaking operations. Early season opening may be delayed by warm weather or insufficient snow base for safe operations. We announce opening decisions 7-10 days in advance through www.mightymountain.com and (970) 555-SNOW as conditions develop each fall.

instruction: What happens if the season gets extended due to good snow?
output: Excellent snow years may extend our season beyond the target April 15 closing date, with announcements made 2-3 weeks in advance based on snow depth and weather forecasts. Extended seasons feature the same lift operations and services, though some restaurants and facilities may have reduced hours. Season passes remain valid through any extended closure date.

instruction: What should I pack for different parts of the season?
output: Early season requires warm layers for cold temperatures and variable conditions, mid-season needs standard winter gear with extra warmth for peak cold periods, while spring skiing calls for lighter layers, sunglasses, and strong sunscreen. Always bring multiple layers regardless of season, as mountain weather changes rapidly. Waterproof outer shells and extra gloves are essential throughout the entire season.

instruction: How do snow conditions typically change throughout the season?
output: Early season features machine-made snow with firm, consistent surfaces, mid-season brings natural powder and variable conditions depending on storms, while spring develops corn snow that's firm in morning and soft by afternoon. Base depths typically build from 20-30 inches in early season to 60-100+ inches at peak. Late season may have limited terrain due to melting and safety considerations.

instruction: What's the difference between visiting in January versus March?
output: January offers the coldest temperatures, deepest powder, and most consistent snow conditions but shorter daylight hours and potentially harsh weather. March features warmer temperatures, longer days, spring snow conditions, and more predictable weather patterns but may lack the deep powder of mid-winter. Both months offer excellent skiing with different experiences and seasonal characteristics.

instruction: When do you typically receive your biggest snowstorms?
output: Colorado's heaviest snowstorms typically occur from January through March, with February historically receiving the most significant accumulations. Storm systems often bring 6-18 inches over 24-48 hour periods followed by clear, cold weather. El Nio and La Nia patterns influence seasonal snowfall totals, with La Nia years generally producing above-average snowfall for our area.

instruction: What are your summer operating hours and season?
output: Summer operations run June through September with scenic lifts operating 9 AM-5 PM daily, weather permitting. Mountain biking, hiking, and other summer activities have varying schedules posted at www.mightymountain.com throughout the season. Summer facilities include limited dining options and retail shops, with full winter services returning in November as ski season preparations begin.

instruction: How do lift ticket prices change throughout the season?
output: Value season (November-December 21, late March-April) features the lowest prices starting at $89, regular season (January-mid March) ranges $129-149, while peak periods (holidays, powder days) reach $159-189. Dynamic pricing adjusts based on demand, weather, and special events. Online purchases save $10 and advance booking locks in current pricing regardless of future increases.

instruction: What terrain typically opens first and last each season?
output: Base area beginner and intermediate trails served by main lifts typically open first as they receive priority snowmaking and are essential for guest access. Expert terrain and high-elevation areas usually open later once adequate base depths are achieved and safety conditions are met. Spring closures begin with expert terrain and high-elevation areas, with base area trails remaining open longest.

instruction: How does altitude affect conditions throughout the season?
output: Our 3,128-foot vertical drop creates significant temperature and snow condition variations, with summit areas (12,408 ft) staying colder and holding snow longer than base areas (9,280 ft). Spring skiing may feature powder at the summit while base areas have corn snow or slush. Altitude also affects weather patterns, with summit areas often experiencing different conditions than the base lodge.

instruction: When is the best time for beginner skiers to visit?
output: January through early March offers the most reliable snow conditions and full terrain access for learning, while spring skiing (March-April) provides warmer, more comfortable weather for beginners but may have limited terrain. Midweek visits during any period offer shorter lift lines, less crowded slopes, and more personalized attention from ski school instructors. Early season may have limited beginner terrain availability.

instruction: What historical weather data can help me plan my visit?
output: Mighty Mountain averages 300-350 inches of annual snowfall with January and February typically receiving the heaviest accumulations. Temperature averages range from 10-25F in winter to 45-65F in spring at base elevation. Historical data shows 80% of seasons open by Thanksgiving and 90% remain open through mid-April, though climate variations can significantly impact individual seasons.

instruction: How do you handle season pass sales and renewal timing?
output: Season pass sales begin each August with early bird pricing through October 31st offering the best rates and payment plan options. Pass renewal reminders are sent to previous year holders in July with priority pricing and purchase periods. New passes go on sale to the general public in September, with prices increasing throughout the fall as the season approaches.
